e4: Adopting the new policy aligns with ethical financial reporting standards and enhances transparency, fostering long-term trust with investors. It mitigates potential legal liabilities associated with biased reporting. Although there may be short-term misunderstandings, clear communication can help investors adapt, ultimately strengthening the company's reputation and increasing investor confidence.
e5: An ethical reporting policy should ensure accuracy, transparency, and consistency in financial disclosures, providing a true representation of financial performance. It must uphold honesty to maintain investor trust and avoid misleading stakeholders. Contextually, factors such as potential impacts on various investor groups and legal compliance also play a role in evaluating ethical practices.
e6: Yes, I would ask how the management team plans to communicate the policy change to investors to ensure clarity and avoid misinterpretation. Additionally, I'd inquire about strategies to support small investors during the transition and how the company intends to monitor investor reactions and feedback post-implementation.
